ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I know some basic Italian. Mostly grammar, but a decent amount of vocab. I could probably survive in Italy if I had to with the language abilities I have now.
I learned the basics of most Italian tenses, a lot of grammar, and a great deal of vocabulary as well! I also enjoyed learning a bit about Italian culture.
Developed great understanding of Italian!
Time management, linguistically skills, memorization, application skills
I have never taken a spoken foreign language before, so I found the class to be quite difficult. Anna made it enjoyable and I looked forward to class everyday.
Basic Italian grammar.
My ability to memorize and learn was really brought out during this course. My knowledge on Italian culture was also expanded.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It really hits you with a lot of vocab but doesn't make you learn it. I learned minimal vocab and was fine on assessments. They really slam you with grammar. But overall, it's a good course. Moves fast, but you learn good info and Italian is fun. Also, Foccaccia Blues is a terrible movie. I am so confused about why we watched it. It was simultaneously incredibly boring and wildly bizarre. Also weirdly sexual in places. It's just a very bad film. I looked it up and it was panned by critics. It is not a good movie. Please pick another film to show.
Strengths: Fun, informative, enjoyable!
The strengths of this course was the teacher and the classroom environment. The weakness of this course was maybe the lack of explanation on a couple of the grammar topics.
There could have been more spoken Italian in class, but other than that the work was reasonable.
I think that it was extremely fast paced and I wish that we had more time me to go over the concepts in class.
I loved the class engagement and ability to speak freely. I wish we had more time in between the tests.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend it, yes. It's tough and I don't like languages, but it's not a bad one to learn, especially if you want to study abroad.
Yes! It is a great deal of work though ... 1.5 credits means 1.5 x the amount of work!
Yes an awesome language course!
I would. I loved this class. I loved the teacher and the things that we learned.
I honestly loved going to Italian everyday, because of Anna and my fellow students, though I do not enjoy foreign language much I would still recommend this class.
Yes! I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot.
I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone thinking of taking a new language. It is amazing and not too hard to learn but not exactly easy. It challenges me but also is so enjoyable to learn.
